Health.summary: A decade-long study reveals that no major Indian city currently boasts a "good" Air Quality Index (AQI), indicating persistent and widespread pollution. Delhi, in particular, has been identified as the worst-affected city, topping the list for poor air quality.
key_points: 10-year study shows no "good" AQI in major Indian cities.
Persistent pollution is a significant issue.
Delhi is the most polluted city.

Health.headline: Measles cases surge in Europe amid rise in global outbreaks, WHO says

Health.headline: Infertility is an ‘overlooked’ public health problem, WHO says
Health.summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has declared infertility an "overlooked" public health problem, highlighting the need for greater awareness and accessible care. This statement aims to bring more attention and resources to a condition affecting millions globally.

Health.headline: Love working out? Dirty air means you won’t get full health benefits
Health.summary: A study suggests that exercising in polluted environments, or "dirty air," can significantly diminish the health benefits of physical activity. This finding indicates that air quality is a crucial factor in maximizing the positive effects of workouts and overall well-being.
key_points: Exercising in dirty air diminishes health benefits.
Air quality is crucial for maximizing workout effects.
Highlights impact of pollution on physical activity.

Health.headline: Undiagnosed HIV: a ‘silent crisis’ growing in Europe
Health.summary: Undiagnosed HIV is being described as a "silent crisis" that is increasingly growing across Europe. This refers to a significant number of individuals living with HIV unaware of their status, hindering treatment and contributing to further transmission.
key_points: Undiagnosed HIV growing in Europe, called "silent crisis."
Many individuals unaware of their HIV status.
Hindering treatment and contributing to transmission.
